statement.tex: Using integration, find the area bounded by the lines \[\qquad y = 2 + x, y = 2 - x\text{ and } x = 2 \]

options.tex:
%text
\[ R = \int_0^2 \left(x+2 \right)\cdot dx - \int_0^2 \left(2-x \right)\cdot dx \]
\incorrect \[ R = \int_0^2 \left(2-x \right)\cdot dx - \int_0^2 \left(x+2 \right)\cdot dx \] %

reason.tex:
%text Between $x=0$ and $x=2$, the line $y = x+2$ is above the line $y = 2-x$ Hence, the required area $R$ will be % \begin{align}
R &= \int_0^2 \left(2+x \right)\cdot dx - \int_0^2 \left(2-x \right)\cdot dx \end{align} %text %

options.tex:
%text
\[ R = 4\text{ sq. units} \]
\incorrect \[ R = 2\text{ sq. units} \] %
